==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|かむ|みや|yomi=k}}
/kamumi<sub>1</sub>ya/ → /kamumiya/. A compound of {{compound|神|tr1=kamu|t1=god|宮|tr2=miya|t2=building|lang=ja}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[kamumiya]|lang=ja}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かむみや}}

# a building that enshrines a god

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|かん|みや|yomi=k}}
/kamumi<sub>1</sub>ya/ → /kamumiya/ → [kammiya] → /kanmiya/. From {{m|ja|神宮|tr=kamumi<sub>1</sub>ya}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{IPA|[kammiya]|lang=ja}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かんみや}}

# a building that enshrines a god
